thread.title: Colombian police free five children from 'Satanic' home | Metro News
thread.title_full: Colombian police free five children from 'Satanic' home | Metro News

author: Charles White
title: Colombian police free five children from 'Satanic' home | Metro News
text:
Inside the ‘Satanic’ home where police freed five children from their parents Charles White Thursday 16 Feb 2017 5:39 pm The children were apparently ‘drugged up’ and dancing (Picture: CEN) 
Five children have been freed by police after they were seen to be malnourished and were reportedly on drugs. 
The police have now taken the kids away from their American-Colombian parents after neighbours saw them ‘dancing around’ with ‘Satanic symbols’ on them. 
Donald Trump attacks 'mess at home and abroad' during rare press conference The children were freed after neighbours heard concerning screams from the Bucaramanga, Colombia, flat. 
Reportedly the children showed signs of malnutrition and abuse. 
Police reported the flat was filled with smoke and that they found ‘burnt offerings’ after breaking open the door. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
They also reportedly found four children aged between two and six, and a three-month-old baby. 
The names of the 49-year-old mother and her American husband have not been revealed but both were said to be under the effect of either alcohol or drugs. 
US to find out if it can survive 'A Day Without Immigrants' Apparently ‘agitated’, the parents were also housing cannabis plants at their flat and police found broken glass and dog excrement strewn across the floor. 
Messages seen from outside the flat show graffiti such as ‘US=Enemies, 666’ and ‘Mundo de la mentira’ or ‘World of lies’. Neighbours called the alarm and police resuced five kids (Picture: CEN) 
The children were apparently whisked away to hospital, with a baby said to have dermatitis and conjunctivitis. 
Their parents were transferred to San Camilo psychiatric hospital where they are said to be under medical surveillance.
